title: Divide Up the Population
text: There are two types of sampling that divide the population into groups of people: stratified and cluster. The differences between the two are that stratified sampling takes a proportionate number of subjects from each stratum to include into the sample while clustering usually means only a few clusters are selected to represent the entire population.

title: Stratified versus Cluster
text: Does the instructor want to pick students from each Lake Tahoe Community College math class? Or does she only want one or two math classes to be represented. If the instructor wants student from each Lake Tahoe Community College math course to be included in the sample, select stratified. If the instructor only wants one or two math classes to be represented, select cluster.
